stem: When a user is on a network, is this a situation that would prevent Desktop Single Sign-On (SSO) from signing the user in automatically?

options.text: The IIS Server is not available
The user does not have a valid Kerberos ticket

stem: An Okta Administrator needs to enable Active Directory mastered users to change passwords in Okta. Is this a step that the administrator needs to take?

options.text: Configure Desktop SSO
Set the Active Directory recovery options to true
Install the Okta Password Sync Agent
Ensure the Okta service account has elevated permissions in Active Directory

stem: Is this the default date range for which events are displayed in the Okta system log?

options.text: Thirty days
Seven days

stem: Users are unable to authenticate to Microsoft OneNote when using Desktop SSO/IWA. Is this a likely cause of the issue the users are experiencing?

options.text: Desktop SSO/IWA does NOT work with OneNote
Desktop SSO/IWA was NOT deployed in HTTPS mode

stem: Is this mapping type available when an administrator maps Okta attributes to Active Directory attributes?

options.text: Clone user in Active Directory
Remove duplicate
Delete user in Active Directory
Do not map
Apply mapping on user create only

stem: Is this information contained in a SAML assertion?

options.text: Access token
Audience URI
Entity ID/Issuer ID
IdP authentication assertion

stem:
Last week, an Okta administrator configured Okta to use Active Directory (AD) for Delegated Authentication. This week, a new Active Directory user is unable to log on to Okta.
Is this a reason why the new Active Directory user might be unable to authenticate?

options.text: The user is outside of an Active Directory Organizational Unit (OU) that has been imported into Okta.
The user was not successfully imported into Okta from Active Directory.
The user account is disabled, or the user is locked out.
